title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: She sung Jock ofHazeldean very well, and with a peculiar expression of humour.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: _June_ 4.--I was obliged to absent myself from the Court on Dr. Ross'spositive instance; and, what is worse, I was compelled to send anapology to Hopetoun House, where I expected to see Madame Caradori, whowas to sing Jock of Hazeldean.

title: From John O'Groats to Land's End; Or, 1372 miles on foot; A book of days and chronicle of adventures by two pedestrians on tour
author: Naylor, John Anderton
snippet: Where Druid shades still flitted round;  In Hawick twinkled many a light;  Behind him soon they set in night;  And soon he spurr'd his courser keen  Beneath the tower of Hazeldean.

title: Eight lands in eight weeks;
author: Snyder, Marcia Penfield. [from old catalog]
snippet: So we all reaped a benefit, and we eight women, who ought to have been at home packing our endless suit-cases and preparing for an early start, kept lingering  for one more song, until "Jack of Hazeldean" and "Will Ye No' Come Back Again ?" made us ready for any dissipation, and found us, long after our prearranged  hour, standing in a circle with crossed hands keeping time to Auld Lang Syne — faster and faster ; down with the clasped hands to beat the measures off ;

title: Days of the past;
author: Shand, Alexander Innes
snippet: My friend, who was of a jovial temperament, and had a fine voice, struck up ' Jock o' Hazeldean.'

title: Night-Lights. Shadows from a doctor's reading-lamp
author: Frost, Arthur Broadfield.
snippet: I pictured them in summer, on such an evening as thatwhereon Randal Leslie strolled back from Hazeldeanto his father's shiftless ruin.
